job description:
The goal of the department of Immunology is to perform multidisciplinary research and educational activities in basic and cancer immunology.

The salary range is min $ 59,200 mid $ 74,200 max $ 88,800.

Research Projects:

Working in collaboration with clinical coordinators.
  • Independently plans, organizes, coordinates, directs and participates in scientific research projects.
  • Organizes and analyzes data from the different clinical trials to be
presented at different meetings.
  • Assigns and reviews work of subordinates.
  • Attends day-to-day meetings pertaining to the Immunotherapy
Platform and informs superior about meeting outcomes.
  • Supervises the design, development, or adapting of equipment used in experiments or research to obtain desired results. Plans and
supervises the training of technicians and other laboratory personnel

with respect to proper laboratory techniques, the use of laboratory

equipment, and safety procedures.
  • Other duties as assigned
Flow Analysis:
  • Optimizes and establishes new immunomonitoring technologies
(such as Cytometry by time-of-fight or CyTOF, UV-mediated ligand

exchange of peptide-MHC class I complexes) to be used at the

Immunotherapy Platform; High dimensional analysis of successful cancer immunotherapy such as R programming, VisNE, Phenograph, Scaffold, SPADEand CITRUS); Single cell gene expression and TCR sequencing.
  • Monitor patients' tissues (blood and tumor) using cutting edge
technologies including Flow Cytometry (18 colors), CyTOF and high order ELISPOT

(3 colors or more), serum analysis using protein/peptide microarrays, etc.

Standard Operating Procedures:

Writes SOP's to be used in the lab.

EDUCATION:

Required: PhD in Natural Science, related field or medical degree.

EXPERIENCE:

Required: Five years of experience in experimental or scientific work.
